Description: String of seventeen beads and amulets in various materials and shapes; three blue and white glass eye-beads, rod-formed with trailed details; one gold spherical bead hammered from sheet metal (dented); eight sard (three biconical, two roughly spherical, two faceted); sard wedjat-eye amulet perforated through the long axis; one barrel-shaped agate bead,; similar shaped rock-crystal (?) bead; one spherical glazed composition (faince) bead; all strung on red string attached to an ivory pin with a bulbous head covered in red felt.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Amathus
Curator's comments: For other examples of wedjat pendants and amulets from Amathus, Clerc 1991, 133-9. Also, Clerc et al. 1976, 118-19 for examples from the sanctuary at Kition-Kathari. Lagarce (in Clerc et al. 1976, 167-74) provides a useful overview of the use and significance of Egyptianizing amulets and scarabs on Cyprus which often differ from those found in Egyptian contexts. Bibliography: Clerc G. 1991, 'Aegyptiaca', in eds V. Karageorghis et al., La nécrople d'Amathonte Tombes 110-385. V (Nicosia), 1-50. Clerc G. et al. 1976, Fouilles de Kition. II. Objets égyptiens et égyptisants (Nicosia).
Bibliographic references: Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p.122, Tomb 180)
